item.title: Credibit Introduces the Future of Money - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Credibit Introduces the Future of Money - NEWSBTC

Credibit is a new digital currency and payment protocol that promises to offer new capabilities to many of the limitations presented by several other cryptocurrencies. It is an open source project released under the MIT/X11 license allowing anyone to run, modify, and copy the software and to distribute, modified copies of the software.

item.title: Blockchain Provider Gem Pursues Expansion Into Health Care Sector
item.description:
Blockchain Provider Gem Pursues Expansion Into Health Care Sector

Gem, a provider of enterprise blockchain development and operations tools, is entering Nashville's booming health care sector. Micah Winkelspecht, the founder and CEO of Gem, said in a recent interview with Venture Nashville that the decision to increase the company's focus on health care was made after a six-month period of growing interest from the industry.

item.title: ANX International to Launch Free Multipurpose Blockchain Platform
item.description:
ANX International to Launch Free Multipurpose Blockchain Platform

Hong Kong-based blockchain developer ANX International is 13 hour away from launching its all-encompassing blockchain services platform. ANX Blockchain Services (ABS) is designed to give any individuals/business the ability to launch their own digital assets like private tokens, loyalty points and coupons, at no cost.

item.title: Lightning Inter-node Protocol: A Primer
item.description:
Lightning Inter-node Protocol: A Primer

The original protocol I wrote for two lightning nodes to communicate was simple: to make a change, you proposed it and sent the signature for their commitment transaction, they replied with the revocation secret for the previous one and a signature for you, then you finished it by providing a signature for them.

item.title: Mitt Romney Tax Hacker Sentenced to Prison for Bitcoin Ransom
item.description:
Mitt Romney Tax Hacker Sentenced to Prison for Bitcoin Ransom

Accepting Bitcoin for illicit transactions is never a good idea, and the alleged hacker of tax records belonging to Mitt Romney has found that out the hard way. Michael Mancil Brown was found guilty of fraud and extortion.

item.title: What kind of machine do you need to mine ethereum?
item.description:
What kind of machine do you need to mine ethereum?

When I was a kid, I was fascinated by Bigfoot and the Loch Ness Monster. Each monster had a controversial / hoax photo associated with it. The 1967 Patterson-Gimlin photo of Bigfoot (allegedly) was very controversial: Per Wikipedia's entry on Bigfoot: Roger Patterson and Robert Gimlin reported that on October 20 they had captured a purported Sasquatch on film at Bluff Creek, Califor...

item.title: What do you think is better to invest in (about 10K) - Bitcoin or Ethereum?
item.description:
What do you think is better to invest in (about 10K) - Bitcoin or Ethereum?

6 people want answers to this question. Be the first to answer.

item.title: Pre-Order With Bitcoin Using Purse Pre - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Pre-Order With Bitcoin Using Purse Pre - Bitcoinist.net

The Bitcoin-based marketplace that has connected the community with discounts at Amazon for using cryptocurrency has just announced the launch Purse Pre. This new Purse Pre market will allow Bitcoin users to place pre-orders on goods and trust they will receive the product or get their digital currency back.

item.title: BitCoinIRA.com allows retirement account owners to possess actual bitcoins
item.description:
BitCoinIRA.com allows retirement account owners to possess actual bitcoins

BitCoinIRA.com, a financial conduit spearheading the use of bitcoin as a retirement tool, announced Tuesday the formal launch of the "Bitcoin IRA." The L.A.-based company is offering what it calls ...

item.description:
Japanese bitcoin exchange Zaif launches coin reserve

Zaif, a Japanese bitcoin exchange, has launched a "Zaif coin reserve" that will enable instant purchases of cryptocurrency, reported EconoTimes. The service will automatically deduct the amount arr...
